data.title: William Shatner’s Secret To Remaining ‘Energetic’ At 93
data.meta_description: When you think of a 90-year-old, "energetic" doesn't come to mind, but we discover William Shatner's secret to achieving just that.
data.text:
When you think of a 90-year-old, “energetic” doesn’t seem to be one of the first things that comes to mind. And yet, William Shatner feels just that, as a 93-year-old, revealing how that can be possible.

While attending the premiere of his new documentary, You Can Call Me Bill, on Thursday (March 21), Shatner told People what has helped him to remain youthful and engaged with his work.

Shatner’s Secret To Youth

The Star Trek alum tells the publication his secret to youth is: “Just staying engaged in life, to stay curious.” However, he chalks it up to luck with having a lot to do with your health. Adding that life and soul energy are also a product of health, you can’t be energetic when you’re sick. For his “luck,” Shatner’s been healthy “all my life.”

Giving his better half kudos for adding to his youthful energy, Shatner says his wife of 19 years, Elizabeth Martin is responsible. He calls Martin, 64, the “zest of life. She brings the flavor.”

Of his 93rd birthday Friday (March 22), Shatner doesn’t really care for “glorifying in it.” However, when it comes to his upcoming documentary, Shatner caved in after being asked over and over to do one. The reason why he previously turned down documentaries about his life is because they seem so “deadly,” as if it is his goodbye to the world. Because of his daughters Leslie, 65, Lisabeth, 62, and Melanie, 59, Shatner’s new film has enabled him to create a “legacy” for his kids.

RELATED: William Shatner Overcomes Fear Of Sharks By Swimming With Them

You Can Call Me Bill looks at Shatner’s decades-long career, including life after his famous role as Captain James T. Kirk in Star Trek. The documentary was fully financed by over 1,200 fans, who raised $750,000 in just four days, per IndieWire. The film is now in select theaters.

Being with the company for over three years, Laila's fierce and fabulous red-carpet rankings have earned her a feature on 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert!' Her favorite stories are those surrounding the latest in celebrity fashion, television and film rankings, and how the world reacts to major celebrity news. With a background in journalism, Laila's stories ensure accuracy and offer background information on stars that you wouldn't have otherwise known. She prides herself in covering stories that inform the public about what is currently happening and what is to come in the ever-changing, ever-evolving media landscape.
